intro: Filipendula camtschatica var. glaberrima, commonly known as the Kamchatka meadow sweet, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It has smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are alternate and pinnately compound. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive flowers.
